recital.text: The Stockbridge-Munsee Community, Band of Mohican Indians, is a federally recognized Indian tribe with inherent sovereign powers, and is governed by the Stockbridge-Munsee Tribal Council pursuant to the 1937 Constitution; and,
The Stockbridge-Munsee Community has the authority under its constitution and its inherent rights as a sovereign nation to adopt and amend Ordinances; and,
Chapter 39, the Utility Ordinance was adopted in 1999 to regulate tribal utilities, including the community water and wastewater systems; and,

The Tribe wishes to expand provisions of the Ordinance that previously addressed only the wastewater system to also address the Tribe's community water system regarding connection to the utilities and the fees for these utilities.

that the Stockbridge-Munsee hereby adopts the amendments by creating Sections 39.15(C); 39.15(D); and 39.15(E) and making technical changes to Sections 39.15(A); 39.15(B(3); 39.18(A); 39.21(A)(2); 39.22(A); 39.22(B); and 39.22(C).
